cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles WSW of Campeche, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander over the southern Bay of Campeche through Thursday, then lift northward toward the central Gulf of Mexico late week-end
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central U.S. Gulf Coast (most likely LA/MS coast) – AFTER the 5-day forecast period

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch/warning currently confined to the coast from Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Bay of Campeche coastline of Mexico
weather_observation.wind: Only a 3 % cumulative chance of 34-kt winds in five days; gale-force winds unlikely through the forecast period
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected through at least 5 days
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rains possible late weekend if Cristobal tracks northward into the central Gulf
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increasing swells/seas for offshore approaches; possible temporary port restrictions for vessels over the weekend
